alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 10:45AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North near Hickson affecting Cass County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. .Temperatures above freezing over the last several days is creating snow melt, with some areas in the southern basin seeing most of the snowpack melted. High temperatures are forecast to remain above freezing and is expected to further ripen the snow pack where it still exists and, with anticipated melting, will cause increased flows of water into the rivers. There will be variations as to degree of snow melt depending on how high temperatures will get over the next several days. This will impact rate of rise in many locations, with some rivers responding quickly and other forecast points seeing a delay in rising levels. At this time, precipitation will be limited. However, if rainfall occurs later over the next few days, it will have an impact on forecast rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie. * WHEN...From Sunday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Some local flooding begins on rural roads and approaches to bridges. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 0.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Sunday evening and continue rising to 14.4 feet Thursday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
